signals: NVIDIA consolida su dominio hasta 2026 con la plataforma Rubin y el despliegue de la serie GPT-5 en GB200.
La competencia en fundición para 2026 entre TSMC, Intel y Samsung definirá el techo de rendimiento del hardware IA.
Auge de la IA Soberana mediante infraestructuras nacionales como Isambard-AI y modelos regionales como UK-LLM.
Transición hacia la IA física y modelos de mundo para potenciar robótica y conducción autónoma end-to-end.
El enfoque de la industria vira del cómputo puro hacia la tecnología de memoria como limitador crítico de rendimiento.
risks: Concentración excesiva de riesgo sistémico en el roadmap de hardware de un solo proveedor dominante.
Cuellos de botella en el ancho de banda de memoria que limitan la escalabilidad de agentes IA complejos.
Complejidad creciente en el empaquetado de chiplets que podría retrasar la disponibilidad de nuevos aceleradores.
watch: Hitos de despliegue de GPT-5.3 Codex y su impacto en la productividad de desarrollo de software.
Progresos en el ecosistema de chiplets para democratizar el diseño de silicio personalizado.
Resultados de los modelos de mundo interactivos de Google en aplicaciones fuera del gaming.

items.title: NVIDIA Rubin Platform, Open Models, Autonomous Driving: NVIDIA Presents Blueprint for the Future at CES
items.summary: NVIDIA founder and CEO Jensen Huang took the stage at the Fontainebleau Las Vegas to open CES 2026, declaring that AI is scaling into every domain and every device. “Computing has been fundamentally reshaped as a result of accelerated computing, as a result of artificial intelligence,” Huang said. “What that means is some $10 trillion Read Article
items.why: El anuncio de Rubin confirma la aceleración del ciclo de hardware de NVIDIA a una cadencia anual disruptiva.

items.title: As AI Grows More Complex, Model Builders Rely on NVIDIA
items.summary: Unveiling what it describes as the most capable model series yet for professional knowledge work, OpenAI launched GPT-5.2 in December. The model was trained and deployed on NVIDIA infrastructure, including NVIDIA Hopper and GB200 NVL72 systems. GPT-5.3 Codex — the first OpenAI agentic coding model to help build itself — was released in February and Read Article
items.why: El despliegue de GPT-5 sobre infraestructura GB200 establece el nuevo estandard de capacidad en modelos de frontera.

items.title: TSMC vs Intel Foundry vs Samsung Foundry 2026
items.summary:
The global semiconductor industry sits at the foundation of modern technology, powering everything from smartphones and cloud data centers to artificial intelligence, automobiles, and national defense systems. At the center of advanced chip manufacturing are three major players: TSMC, Samsung Foundry, and Intel Foundry… Read More

The post TSMC vs Intel Foundry vs Samsung Foundry 2026 appeared first on SemiWiki.
items.why: La competencia en 2nm y empaquetado avanzado para 2026 es el pilar que sostendrá el crecimiento de toda la industria IA.

items.title: How Memory Technology Is Powering the Next Era of Compute
items.summary:
For more than a decade, progress in artificial intelligence has been framed almost entirely through the lens of compute. Faster GPUs, denser accelerators, and higher TOPS defined each new generation. But as generative and agentic AI enter their next phase, that framing is no longer sufficient. The most advanced AI systems today… Read More

The post How Memory Technology Is Powering the Next Era of Compute appeared first on SemiWiki.
items.why: La memoria se identifica como el factor determinante para superar los límites actuales de latencia en IA agente.

items.title: NVIDIA Releases New AI Models and Developer Tools to Advance Autonomous Vehicle Ecosystem
items.summary: Autonomous vehicle (AV) stacks are evolving from many distinct models to a unified, end-to-end architecture that executes driving actions directly from sensor data. This transition to using larger models is drastically increasing the demand for high-quality, physically based sensor data for training, testing and validation. To help accelerate the development of next-generation AV architectures, NVIDIA Read Article
items.why: El cambio hacia arquitecturas unificadas sensor-a-acción acelera la viabilidad de la conducción autónoma total.

items.title: Silicon Catalyst at the Chiplet Summit: Advancing the Chiplet Economy
items.summary:
The rapid evolution of semiconductor design has elevated chiplets from a niche concept to a foundational strategy for next-generation computing. At the upcoming Chiplet Summit – February 17–19, 2026 Santa Clara Convention Center. Silicon Catalyst will play a central role in shaping this conversation, highlighting… Read More

The post Silicon Catalyst at the Chiplet Summit: Advancing the Chiplet Economy appeared first on SemiWiki.
items.why: La transición a una economía de chiplets es vital para mantener la Ley de Moore en la era de los grandes modelos.

items.title: Hear more about interactive world models in our latest podcast.
items.summary: Project Genie: Create and explore worlds
items.why: Project Genie representa un avance en modelos capaces de entender y generar entornos dinámicos e interactivos.

items.title: NVIDIA Research Shapes Physical AI
items.summary: AI and graphics research breakthroughs in neural rendering, 3D generation and world simulation power robotics, autonomous vehicles and content creation.
items.why: La IA física es el siguiente paso lógico para la automatización industrial y robótica de servicios.

items.title: Giving AI Agents Access to a Compiled Design and Verification Database
items.summary:
A few weeks ago, I had the chance to work with AMIQ EDA as they introduced a new product: DVT MCP Server. I was quite intrigued by the role it will play in AI-assisted chip design and verification, so I wanted to learn more. I spoke with Gabriel Busuioc, the AI Assistant team leader at AMIQ EDA, to understand more about the product and how… Read More

The post Giving AI Agents Access to a Compiled Design and Verification Database appeared first on SemiWiki.
items.why: Agentes de IA con acceso a bases de datos de diseño aceleran drásticamente el ciclo de verificación de silicio.

items.title: Isambard-AI, the UK’s Most Powerful AI Supercomputer, Goes Live
items.summary: The University of Bristol’s Isambard-AI, powered by NVIDIA Grace Hopper Superchips, delivers 21 exaflops of AI performance, making it the fastest system in the U.K. and among the most energy-efficient globally.
items.why: Isambard-AI posiciona al Reino Unido con capacidad de cómputo exaescala dedicada a la investigación abierta.

items.title: Reaching Across the Isles: UK-LLM Brings AI to UK Languages With NVIDIA Nemotron
items.summary: Celtic languages — including Cornish, Irish, Scottish Gaelic and Welsh — are the U.K.’s oldest living languages. To empower their speakers, the UK-LLM sovereign AI initiative is building an AI model based on NVIDIA Nemotron that can reason in both English and Welsh, a language spoken by about 850,000 people in Wales today. Enabling high-quality Read Article
items.why: Iniciativas de IA soberana reducen la dependencia cultural y tecnológica de modelos genéricos anglocéntricos.

items.title: Innovation to Impact: How NVIDIA Research Fuels Transformative Work in AI, Graphics and Beyond
items.summary: The roots of many of NVIDIA’s landmark innovations — the foundational technology that powers AI, accelerated computing, real-time ray tracing and seamlessly connected data centers — can be found in the company’s research organization, a global team of around 400 experts in fields including computer architecture, generative AI, graphics and robotics. Established in 2006 and Read Article
items.why: La investigación fundamental asegura el flujo de innovaciones que se comercializarán en las próximas décadas.

items.title: Natively Adaptive Interfaces: A new framework for AI accessibility
items.summary: A collage of four images, the first of a woman with curly hair in front of a silver laptop, the second of the same woman and a man with short black hair speaking on a stairwell, the third of a the same man with glasses, and an aerial image of NTID
items.why: Nuevas interfaces adaptativas mejoran la accesibilidad, integrando la IA en la experiencia de usuario final.

items.title: It’s a Sign: AI Platform for Teaching American Sign Language Aims to Bridge Communication Gaps
items.summary: American Sign Language is the third most prevalent language in the United States — but there are vastly fewer AI tools developed with ASL data than data representing the country’s most common languages, English and Spanish. NVIDIA, the American Society for Deaf Children and creative agency Hello Monday are helping close this gap with Signs, Read Article
items.why: Aplicación de IA en lenguajes de señas demuestra valor social, aunque con nicho de mercado específico.

items.title: Applications Now Open for $60,000 NVIDIA Graduate Fellowship Awards
items.summary: Bringing together the world’s brightest minds and the latest accelerated computing technology leads to powerful breakthroughs that help tackle some of the biggest research problems. To foster such innovation, the NVIDIA Graduate Fellowship Program provides grants, mentors and technical support to doctoral students doing outstanding research relevant to NVIDIA technologies. The program, in its 25th Read Article
items.why: Inversión en talento doctoral; impacto estratégico a largo plazo pero bajo impacto inmediato en mercado.
